gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Region
Class Region

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Region.Region
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnnularRegion, BoxRegion, DoubleWedgeRegion, EllipseRegion, LineRegion, PointRegion, TableRegion, WedgeRegion
public abstract class Region
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a base class for all regions in the Region package. A Region is used to pass selected regions (selected using the Selection Overlay) from a view component to the viewer. Given the defining points of a region, subclasses of this class can return all of the points inside the selected region. The defining points are saved in the world coordinate system, so all subclasses must map the defining points to image values before using. ALL CLASSES THAT USE THE REGION CLASS SHOULD CALL setWorldBounds() AND setImageBounds() IMMEDIATELY AFTER CONSTRUCTING A REGION INSTANCE.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setWorldBounds

public void setWorldBounds(CoordBounds wb)
Set the world coordinate system. This must be done immediately following the construction of the Region since the selected area is dependent on the image and world bounds.

Parameters:
wb - The world bounds.

setImageBounds

public void setImageBounds(CoordBounds ib)
Set the image coordinate system. This must be done immediately following the construction of the Region since the selected area is dependent on the image and world bounds.

Parameters:
ib - The image bounds.

getWorldBounds

public CoordBounds getWorldBounds()
Get the world coordinate bounds for the region.

getImageBounds

public CoordBounds getImageBounds()
Get the image coordinate bounds for the region.

convertFloatPoint

public floatPoint2D convertFloatPoint(floatPoint2D fpt,
                                      int to_coordsystem)
This method converts a floatPoint2D from one coordinate system to the coordinate system specified. It is assumed that the floatPoint2D lives in either the image or world coordinate system. If image coordinates are converted to world coords, the world coordinate values at the center of the pixel are returned.

Parameters:
fpt - floatPoint2D that is going to be mapped to the other coord system.
to_coordsystem - The coordinate system the point will be mapped TO.
Returns:
the mapped floatPoint2D.

getDefiningPoints

public floatPoint2D[] getDefiningPoints(int coordsystem)
Get the world coordinate points used to define the geometric shape.

Parameters:
coordsystem - The coordinate system from which the defining points are taken from, either WORLD or IMAGE.
Returns:
array of points that define the region.

equals

public boolean equals(Region reg2)
Compare two regions. This will return true only if the two intances are of the same class, have the same world_to_image transform, and have identical defining points. Be aware that it is difficult to compare float values reliably, so even identical regions will return false if one of the values is off by a small amount. This will reliably return true if the references of the two regions match.

Parameters:
reg2 - The region to be compared.
Returns:
true if equal, false if not.

getSelectedPoints

public abstract java.awt.Point[] getSelectedPoints()
Get all of the image points inside the region. The use of Point was chosen over floatPoint2D because at this point we are dealing with row/column coordinates, so rounding is acceptable. This method assumes that the input points are in (x,y) where (x = col, y = row ) form.

Returns:
array of points included within the region.

toString

public abstract java.lang.String toString()
Displays the Region type and its defining points.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

getRegionBounds

public abstract CoordBounds getRegionBounds()
This method is defines a rectangular bounds that the region is contained in.

Returns:
Rectangular bounds containing the region.

getRegionUnion

public static java.awt.Point[] getRegionUnion(Region[] regions)
This method removes duplicate points selected by multiple regions. Calling this method will combine all regions' selected points into one list of points, where each point is unique.

Parameters:
regions - The list of regions to be unionized.
Returns:
A list of unique points for all of the regions.
